review: I have been in Casas del Lago for a week with my boyfriend, and we had one of the best weeks ever. The hotel is beautiful with balinese beds, beach club, DJ and pool. We had lunch in their restaurant everyday and i recommend you the ham croquettes and the French salad. Everything was absolutely perfect 😍i would only change the DJ's schedule from 2pm to 5pm for a bit later 4pm to 7pm.

title: No accepted American Express
review: Dear Monica N,  Thank you very much for your lovely review regarding our Casas del Lago Hotel. We are happy to read that you enjoyed our facilities.  We are looking forward to receiving you again in the very near future.  Warm regards, Head Receptionist Elisabet Benejam

title: A Great Holiday
review: This is a very relaxing hotel.  Very spacious rooms which are tastefully decorated and very clean.  Best rooms overlooking the pool area. Plenty of sun beds.   Very nice breakfast.  Well equipped kitchenettes  Lovely views across the port Excellent hotel can highly recommend

title: Perfect place to relax
review: See previous comments. We enjoyed our holiday so much that there was nothing that they could improve on. Our suit location was in the right location (upper garden view suit No.16 overlooking pool and harbour) to enable us to have a night cap on our balcony and listen to the live entertainment.

title: Ask for Miguel....
review: Dear Richard,  Thank you for your nice comment and the time spent on your review, we really appreciate our guests feedback. We are glad to hear you had nice time with us.  We hope to see you soon on your next visit to Menorca.  Head receptionist Elisabet Benejan

title: Nice and Relaxing
review: Couldn't have been happier.  If only I'd have known tomorrow's menu today it would have been perfect.  Second best place I've ever stayed and best within a three hour flight from Cardiff. Can't say enough

title: Superb, Relaxing and Romantic
review: Dear Elenesse,  Thank you for your comment and the time spent on your review, we really appreciate our guests feedback. Miguel is very gratefull for your commet and we are very glad to hear that you enjoy your time with us.  We hope to see you soon on your next visit to Menorca.  Head receptionist Elisabet Benejan

title: Get away from it all relaxing week in the sun
review: Fantastic Hotel, we stayed there for 7 night at the end of July, in one of the new rooms under the pool area facing the marina.  Very clean, staff very helpful, quiet friendly area, very family orientated so if youre looking for adults only experience, best to say in the resort or go to nearby Ciutdadella. Overall a very pleasant stay, we would definitely go back if it wasn´t for the area it is in.

title: Lovely place 💟
review: The place is adults only. So peaceful and chill out music all day long. DJ next to the pool almost all day. Live music in the evening. Spa is tiny but has everything you need. Lovely personal(with one exception).   Noemi is the best receptionist ever. Ismael the best waiter should be a manager of the restaurant.  Stay away from waitress Patricia. She is very rude to the girls but flirting with all the men (all the ages and sizes) in a very inappropriate way. Thanks God me and my husband have a good sense of humor to take it as a joke otherwise it could destroy our experience.

title: Amazing place!
review: We loved this place!. The staff were very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast offers a  delicious food. We stayed at the villas, which are in a quiet private area, with a private pool. The rooms are clean and nice. The hotel is close to the beach (walk distance); and   only 25 minutes south from the beautiful small city of Ciutadella.  The island have such an excellent beaches that are a must see, like Cala Turqueta or Macarella & Macaralleta.

title: Nice but expensive
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to add your review of Casas del Lago Hotel. We really appreciate your good comments about our staff. It is a pleasure to read that you enjoyed your holidays in Menorca and at our Hotel.  Best Regards,  Elisabet Benejam

title: Too short a break on the stunning island of Menorca
review: Booked this adult holiday for a nice change. Was expensive but thought it would be worth it. Arrived about 2pm in the afternoon reception busy but we were dealt with as soon as they could. Room wasnt ready but they took the eco tax from us while we waited. Went to the pool bar for a beer while we waited for our room. Returned to reception at 3 as arranged and yes our room was ready. We were given our key which was a plastic card and a safe key. We went to find our room which was room 4 behind the pool bar we climbed up the steps and tried to get in the room we werent given any instructions how to get in i ended up finding a cleaner who showed us  how. The room was spacious with a separate lounge to the bedroom. We unpacked and tried to leave to get some supplies in but our key…

title: THE PLACE TO STAY IN MINORCA
review: Arriving late in the evening, we couldn't fault the service of the reception staff - very friendly, informative and service minded. Be aware that the bus, if travelling charter, most likely does a de-tour for drop off's, as Cala'n Bosch is farthest south on the tip of the island - so although the island is less than 60 kilometers long, it took nearly two hours to get to the hotel. Car for us next time! Booked rooms overlooking the pool - best spot, we think - also the upstairs room with balcony. Great rooms, with functioning A/C - beautiful colour scheme - really hit the right spot. Beautiful pool area. Great breakfast, start serving at 08.00 - bit late for those of us who want to get up and go, but rumor has it they could prepare a brown bag for you. Dinner was very nice,…

title: Splendid resort!
review: Our stay at Casas del Lago was amazing. The staff was very polite and helpful. The breakfast was amazing, great variety and rich. The outdoor pool is tranquil and has a great relaxing background music.  On our first night, the staff forgot to clean our room. Once we returned at 11:00pm, we told the reception about the inconvenience. The staff was very sorry, so they cleaned our room and also gave us a free bottle of prosecco.  So glad we stayed at this hotel, would totally recommend and hope to come back!

title: Superb Experience
review: Dear srcarts  Thank you very much for your lovely review regarding our Casas del Lago Hotel. We really appreciate your good comments about the facilities, cleaning, staff and services. We are happy to read that you enjoyed our facilities such as our spa and the hotel services. We always do our best to help our guests and solve any issue. We are looking forward to receiving you again in the very near future.  Head Receptionist

title: Perfect relaxing holiday.
review: The hotel is ajewel in a great location. It's tranquil yet vibrant. Views, pool fantastic. only beach club in Menorca Rooms space with luxury  Food choice around the hotel great.Outstanding service spa

title: May 2017
review: Dear Deepakshi M,  Thank you for your review regarding our hotel! We hope that you enjoyed our facilities and servicies.  We are looking forward to receveing you again in the very near future.  Warm regards,   Recepction department.

title: Lovely adult only hotel
review: We have just returned from a weeks holiday at Casas del Lago. We had a great time. We stayed bed and breakfast in a two bedroom apartment. The breakfast were lovely. English bacon and sausage was a nice bonus. The apartment was very roomy and kept spotlessly clean as was the whole complex. The pool areas feels very luxurious and stylish and we thought the DJ's added an extra touch to the days. Loved the beanbags in the pool. Balinese beds were worth reserving (at no cost). All the staff were very friendly and helpful. We ate out every night and there were a lot of restaurants to chose from around the marina. We would definitely return and would recommend to anyone wanting a relaxing holiday.

title: Splendid Hotel
review: A very good Hotel for adults, you have to be over 16 to live there. Breakfast and dinner are exellent, and the staff all around the Hotel are extremely service-minded. Nice pool-area and our suite was splendid. Menorca was a nice isle, I really recommend a visit.

title: Noisy Casas del Lago Hotel
review: Dear Agneta,  I want to thank your comment and your positive feedback, we are glad to hear you had a fantastic holiday with us.  Hope to see you soon,  Elisabet Benejam

title: Chilled, adult only break
review: The hotel is in a great position overlooking Calan Bosch marina with modern rooms with a minimalistic twist with good facilities ,the man made beach is on the first floor with plenty of sunbeds  round ones have to booked in advance.The restaurant has indoor and outdoor seating with a good buffet breakfast but an indifferent choice for dinner very often spoilt by food left to go dry in dishes through neglect .We really would have loved to have given this hotel a higher score but because of the poor dinners and the incessant recorded music on a on a loop with speakers all over the hotel grounds all day and evening sometimes very intrusive with disco in the afternoons , our room 107 under the bar seating area with a speaker just above us it was not nice to sit out on our lovely…

title: Best Hotel
review: Dear Barrie,  Thanks for your feedback review regarding our Casas del Lago Hotel. We always try to improve our service, your comments are very well welcomed. We are looking forward to receiving you again in the very near future to impress on your next visit.  Kind regards, Reception department.

title: Excellent Hotel
review: My husband and I have just returned from  a 5 day break here.  We wanted just a few dates away to recharge after a stressful few months, and that's exactly what we did. We booked direct with the hotel as it was a better deal and you received a few extras. On arrival we were upgraded to a better room, and we think it probably had the best view in the hotel.  We had a huge patio that looked directly over the marina, stunning and great to share a bottle of wine watching the world go by.  We also had a lounge area with this room.   The pool area was the focal point of the hotel, plenty of sunbeds and the Bali beds you could book free of charge the day before.  There was chilled out music playing in the background and just whispers of people talking and we found it so peaceful and…

title: Lovely hotel
review: I was concerned at the mixed reviews for this hotel and was surprised to read poor reviews even while we were enjoying a superb 10 days of a half-board stay. We had a suite, no 48, which was large comfortable and well enough equipped. The bed was a super grand and comfortable; the bathroom was clean with plenty of towels and toiletries; the lounge included a table and chairs which we never used; and the balcony from our first floor room prided a view of both the garden and the marina. Food was excellent and much better than we experienced in the restaurants around the marina. Breakfast provided an amazing range of items and dinner included different buffet items every night of our 10 day stay as well as items that were cooked freshly for us, both meat and fish. The staff were…

title: Great Hotel pity about the reception staff and thought this was adult only
review: Dear hayesej,  Thank you very much for your lovely review regarding our Casas del Lago Hotel. We really appreciate your good comments about the facilities, cleaning and services.  We are looking forward to receiving you again in the very near future.  Best regards,  Reception department.

title: Great hotel and good SPA facilities
review: A very cool hotel with great views across the marina, great facilities, including great pool area where chill out music is played, then in the afternoon a dj plays a great selection of more chill out music the pool has floating bean bags big enough for 2. The bar serves drinks from 10.30am and food from 1pm and stays open until 12pm which is a shame when you are on holiday.   The hotel has a adult only policy but does not adhere to this as when we stayed it was clear that none of the staff challenged and couple who walked in and purchased a drink at the bar, the child was no more than 12 years old and was running about in the bar area. Sounds like I'm a miserable old sod but if I'm paying for adult only that's what expect.  The management needs to deal with a few members of…

title: Fabulous holiday
review: Dear David H,  We are so sorry to read that your stay with us was not as great as we always desire for our guests.  Regarding the kid on the swimmingpool, we are very surprised since all our staff is aware about this and it is not allowed. This is why we changed the rules and from now on the pool area it is only for hotel guests.  There is no charge for the loss of a key, my apologies for the inconveniences caused and how you felt about the service, we try to do our best to make our guests feel like home. We will take all your words in consideration to keep improving.  We will be delighted to have you back to have the chance to compensate the bad feeling with an amazing holiday.  Yours sinceresly, Head Receptionist

title: Beautiful hotel under poor management
review: We had a good stay at the hotel. The most we enjoyed was SPA facilities, when you book a treatment given a voucher to use SPA. Great treatments. The best massage - deep tissue with Julia. We were even given one free treatment each as we were having those almost every day.   SPA team helpful and friendly. Hotel staff is friendly and helpful as well.   Long queues at reception, should be improved.   Bar at nigh closes a bit too early. Given space and atmosphere wanted a bit more entertainment in the evenings or at least longer bar hours.   Great pool area outside, interior and exterior is very neat, cosy and pleasant. Pebbles by the pool area could be changed to sand as painful to walk.   Thanks to the Casa del Lago team for a great stay.

title: Very nice place
review: Clean & tidy hotel, breakfast great, evening food a bit hit & miss. We still cant work out why they had a DJ every day between 12 - 4pm who did not take request just did his own thing, I thought he was the life guard the first few days. Would go back to this hotel but only Bed & Breakfast.

title: Nice Hotel
review: Dear guest,  We truly appreciate your response, feedback is important to let us grow and learn. We will try to improve regarding all the comments of our clients.We will be very happy to have you back soon and impress you with our progress.  Yours truly,  Head of reception desk

title: Lovely hotel, very poorly managed
review: We spent 7 nights at the Casa del Lago Hotel in June and were very impressed by the rooms, pool area which was spotless, and excellent food. The staff were friendly and helpful and and the resort itself was idea for a week away in the sun. We really enjoyed our visit and would certainly recommend it, and would return.

title: Wellness i
review: Dear Paul,  We appreciate your feedback and we are glad you had such a good experience in Minorca with us. We hope to see you soon in our hotel.  Regards,  Head reception desk Manager,

title: Wow.... reception staff were brill
review: Arrived to be told room would not be ready until 3pm which is later than we have experienced anywhere on our numerous hotel stays. Room was actually not ready until 3.30pm Room was functional, very clean and apparently only just opened. Poolside very nice but spoilt by constant problems with arguments over who had and had not booked beds. No guests (including us) had been advised of the need to book and on one morning  we were asked to move on two separate occasions. Poolside music too loud and "DJ" played from 2-6pm each day. Mix of rap and trance music including tracks  containing foul language. Completely unnecessary when gentle background music would suffice. Returned to room at 4pm (to escape poolside din) and found room door had been wedged open as was the fire escape door…

title: Poolside complete chaos
review: We recently visited this hotel on out third trip.  Great hotel, location, staff.   Unfortunately new management!!  Every other year you paid for a balinese bed and got 2 free mojitos which was great, you knew you had your bed, end of story.  This year it you book at the pool bar, unfortunately, not everyone knows this, not advertised anywhere in the hotel so you end up having to argue with bar staff and let them try to sort the situation out.  The beds are free though, when you eventually get one.   Make sure your name is on the list at the bar.   The staff see oblivious to the fact that the new management is useless and have made a simple system chaotic.    In the past the pool bar staff have been great, friendly, efficient and knew what they were doing.  We spoke to one ex…

title: What a complete disaster!
review: To give some background, I booked this holiday through Expedia in November 2016 as I was on a SCITT programme training to be a primary school teacher and my husband works hard so we thought a holiday would be a nice way to end a year of hard graft!   By February 2017, Thomas Cook had changed our flight by a day. I called Expedia and explained that they had to change the hotel to match, whilst I rang Thomas Cook to enquire why the flight had be changed. Eventually Thomas Cook explained there had been a change due to not enough people booking the day (flying on a Sunday) so we received 20kg luggage each in the hold, meal on flight and choice of seat for both of us, each way. Expedia then got back to me to explain they'd amended the dates and we had been upgraded as they didn't…

title: Great hotel and great staff
review: Dear Alex,  We want to thank your sincere comment and we encourage you to book your next holidays with us.   Best regards,  Elisabet Benejam

title: Really lovely hotel for our honeymoon.
review: We booked this holiday as a relaxing unwind from work and it didn't disappoint. We had a great time and the reception and bar staff were very accommodating and conscientious. The pool area was very relaxing with chilled out music in the day. We used local amenities including jet skis, horse riding as well as taking daily runs along the coast. All in all a great holiday and one of the best hotels on the island!

title: Nice hotel but not quite ready
review: Dear Adams,  We really apreciate your comment, we are glad to hear you had such a good experience with us. We encourage you to book next year with us.  Regards,  Elisabet Benejam

title: Total relaxation
review: Stayed at this hotel from the 23rd June 2017 until the 30th June 2017. We were a bit apprehensive after reading some of the recent reviews but shouldn't have as this Hotel is all about making sure that you are catered for in every respect. I cannot praise the staff highly enough ! They are on the go all the time. The music played by the pool is soothing and not loud as some of the reviews said.The food is of a very high standard and the taster sweets make you feel like you're not over indulging, even though you are. I would highly recommend this Hotel on a half board basis. 10/10

title: 3rd fantastic visit to Casas Del Lago
review: Dear Jamie We really appreciate your comment and We always try to make your stay as perfect as possible. We encourage you to book next holidays in Menorca with us.  Warm regards,  Elisabet Benejam

title: Only given a 2* because of the view and location
review: My wife and I had our third holiday from 12th to 19th June at Casas Del Lago and as our previous visits we can not find any real fault except this year they have replaced the artificial grass around the pool area with what can only be described as grit, small sharp stones some that can hurt your feet when you walk on them especially when it gets on the decked walkway or in the pool. Don't think it's a good idea and possibly an accident waiting to happen (note to management) which could lead to compensation claims. Otherwise a wonderful relaxing holiday and we would very much like to thank all the staff for making it happen again. Looking forward to our next visit to Casas Del Lago which we have already booked for this September and are looking to another relaxing break and been…

title: Bungalows
review: Dear Pat, We really appreciate your comment and we will try to improve on te areas of lackness. We always try to make your stay as perfect as possible. See you soon :) Warm regards,  Elisabet Benejam

title: A faboulas little gem
review: Avoid rooms 35-60 back straight onto main road and bus stop out your window.  Smelly air con and drains  Leaky sink  Piddly shower  Poor customer service and slow waiters  Sent food back because it was cold and was just reheated  Staying at Macarella next year

title: Quiet and relaxing
review: The only busy time of day here was breakfast but that was perfectly manageable - no issues re.table availability and a great range of breakfast options.    Could do with more information on arrival either from reception staff or a guide on hotel facilities (rather than just the spa) and how things work (particularly booking balinese/round lounge beds, beach towels, etc). We were shown one of their new rooms (that front the marina and effectively beneath the pool) that had only been completed the day before we arrived - the language barrier meant we weren't sure why we were being shown the room but subsequently realised we were able to upgrade from the marina view suites - which we did. The room was very comfortable and relatively quiet with a larger balcony that included…

title: A lovely relaxing holiday
review: We were a little concerned as we had been warned that there were building works at this hotel but these were only progressing slowly and didn't impact our holiday at all.  Reception This was a bit muddled at first as they were training new staff but things improved during our holiday and any enquiries we made were sorted. We were shown to our room to demonstrate how the door cards worked which was very helpful.  Staff were friendly, helpful and courteous throughout our holiday.  Room We had a spacious, well equipped suite with a large patio outside the front door.  It was also reasonably quiet.  If you want a quiet holiday I suggest that you don’t get a room overlooking the marina as there are some quite loud live acts competing with each other in the evening.  No problem though…

title: The Good,The Bad & The Ugly
review: The Good - Fantastic location. More than ample sunbeds. The Round beds 16 euro  per day, Bali and Square 18 euro per day. All other beds free. The older rooms seem to be bigger than the newer more expensive. We had a cheaper older room which consisted of huge living area, well equipped kitchen including microwave, iron, fridge . kettle etc. Full bathroom with robes and a bedroom. Breakfast was very good. The Bad - Food was mediocre for a 4* hotel. Entertainment was poor to non existent. The music around the pool was dreadful. We were there for 10 days and the same tape was played throughout and there was a DJ who had a mixing desk and attended for approx. 3hrs each day. Awful. The Ugly - The beds around the pool area were placed on top of a fine gravel (the only reason I can…

title: Chilled break
review: Just got back from a chilled 5 night stay at the Casas del Lago with a friend.  The hotel is in a great position; walking distance to beach and Marina.  We both had a lovely time.  The pool area is lovely and we had no problems with sunbeds.  The rooms are clean and simple, the food was mostly good.  Breakfasts are varied and plentiful and very nice, lunches from the beach bar are excellent and evening meals are okay.  Staff are friendly and helpful. The only reason I gave it 4 stars are for a few minor niggles.  The background music was repetitive and we heard the same songs and singer over and over and over again.  The bath towels were thin and small.  The air con wasn't really effective and the rooms were very stuffy.  We were full board and had VIP bracelets but the staff…

title: Amazing hotel. Great location
review: This hotel is all about relaxing, adults only and a great location. Stunning hotel for the money, great bunch of staff members. Hotel spotless. We will be coming back here for sure... I would advise bed and breakfast only as there are many great places to eat within 10 minutes walk.

title: Our week in the sun
review: All I can say is thank you to the cast de lago!!! Our stay was more than we could have wished for ! The hotel is spotless in a totally fab location and re charged our batteries fully! The mis of blue and white from Mother Nature that follows through the hotel is just so calming! We loved the marina and wide choice of restaurants and the relaxed civilised atmosphere we got engaged whilst there!  Needless to say we will be back!😍

title: What a great hotel
review: Well this hotel has just about got everything right with a few little exceptions.  The room we had 59 was a beautiful suite with a wet room. It was styled in a lovely minimalistic style in blue and white. The only issue we had was that the air con was not very effective and had the engineer out 3 times to fix it unsuccessfully.  We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis as we wanted to take advantage of all the lovely restaurants that surrounded the bay.  The breakfast option where excellent with a full English option or the more healthy continental style breakfast. They offer real juice not the stuff made from concentrate and a range of nespresso coffees.  The first day we used a sun bed on the gravel side of the pool. We did not like the gravel so we block booked a Bali bed these…

title: If you want to be chilled out...look no further..!!
review: Just home from a week at the 'Casa del Lago' and I must say its the most relaxed holiday location I have visited.  Even the colour scheme gives a fresh relaxed and portrays a professional, modern feel.  Poolside you will be treated to relaxing music which enhances the relaxation feel and as there is no real background noise of traffic etc once you lay back on the many available sunbeds its not long before you drift off.  All the surroundings of the pool area are clean as its the Beach Club pool bar.    Restaurant and associated food was fantastic, mainly in part to it not being a massive area which you see in some accommodation, and even Tattinger Champagne is available on the breakfast buffet.    Overlooks the main harbour and in the distance shops and bars where you can take a…

title: At last! A hotel that is as good as it looks in the brochure.
review: Just spent a week at this hotel and it certainly lived up to expectations. The staff were excellent and the gardens and poolside were beautiful. We originally chose half board at this hotel for the 'dine around' option as we sometimes find buffet restaurants a bit like eating in a staff canteen but in fact we ate in the hotel every night as the restaurant was small with a beautiful terrace and the helpful, friendly and attentive staff made dining there a pleasure and certainly a 4 star experience. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the dinner menu suited us just fine....maybe not for everyone as it was typically Spanish with lots of fish dishes. As I don't have a sweet tooth I really appreciated the daily cheese/cracker selection as an alternative to the sweet trolley.  My…

title: Chilled out week in the sun with a friend!!
review: Stayed at Casas del Lago for a week at the beginning of June with a friend.  What a lovely hotel.  It is immaculately clean with contemporary colours and beautifully located overlooking the harbour.  The staff at the hotel are second to none.  The reception staff were wonderful, always so cheerful and happy and more than willing to help when needed.  We had a problem when Thomson had failed to book our return taxi to the airport.  Having waited 20 minutes we asked the reception staff to help.  They spoke to Thomsons and dealt with the problem for us.  Bar staff around the pool were also very attentive and we loved the mojitos and nachos!! In fact all the food at the pool bar was very good.  By way of this review I would like to commend all the staff at this hotel; it is not…

title: Nice hotel, good facilities, not run very well though
review: We stayed for a week end of May/early June for our honeymoon & they upgraded us to a room with sea view + gave us a coupon for a free bottle of cava & bed by the pool which was nice Room was ultra modern, nice mood lighting & bed was really comfy Spa was state of the art & a nice way to relax on a day when the weather wasn't great Most staff very friendly especially Lydia on the poolside bar & noemi in reception We had the BBQ one day & were served raw chicken we sent it back but we're told by the manager that's how they eat it in Spain! Total nonsense, he didn't even apologise just brought out some very thin fillets very well done The hotel seemed to lack something, didn't have the right atmosphere maybe as it's adults only & as we have kids it just seemed very quiet + soulless…

title: Beautiful and relaxing
review: We spent a relaxing week at casas del lago and where very impressed by the setting and the team of people working there. There was a wide range of interesting dishes both at breakfast and dinner. The restaurant has a great view and we were able to sit outside which we enjoyed. The waiters where extremely helpful and professional. The pool was fairly quiet with plenty of space. The music added to the relaxed atmosphere and was not intrusive or too loud. It was a short bus rise to cuitadella and a ten minute walk to the next beach. There is also a beach across the road which was beautiful.  We stayed in a garden view suite which was spotlessly clean and stylish. The staff where quick to sort out minor problems.  We had a fantastic week and hope to return in the future.

title: Very nice indeed but not quite perfect
review: An unimposing entrance but a warm welcome.  Beautifully situated at the rear with views across the bay.  Dreadful muzak played from dawn to dusk. We had a very good 3  bed suite.  Not luxurious but comfortable and quite well equipped.  A very good spa, one of the best.  Food plentiful and good but somehow never hot.  Very good staffing in all departments.  Only drawback was that the binmen arrived and carried out their task noisily at 4am.

title: Hotel casas del lago
review: Very nice hotel clean very helpful staff throughout the hotel. Only let down is the shower has no power just a trickle compared to other hotels I have stayed in the area. That said what a wonderful stay.

title: Very Relaxing Hotel....
review: This is quite like no other hotel we have visited,firstly,the room,a Harbour View room,overlooking the pool and Harbour,of course,was very surprised by the size,a huge lounge,capable of taking a single bed,as well as the settee,table,chairs etc,and basic self catering fascilites, if required,we were on a half-board basis,very clean and minimalistic,into a small bedroom,with the wardrobe directly behind the door,so every time you used it,the doors banged,and no-one could get past,but we worked with it.True from other reviews,the bathrooms are a little dated,but ours was ok,and very clean. The pool area was well kept,and a decent pool,and the 'Beach Club' bar which served food,was very good. One issue not raised before,the sunbed loungers are situated on what can only be called…

title: Lovely well run hotel
review: We loved our stay for 2 nights at casa del lago All the staff from reception  spa dining beach bar to the gardener couldn't be more helpful and friendly. A nice happy place to chill. Very well run place,it is immaculately kept and offers a lovely relaxed atmosphere for its guests,also the food we had was of good quality. Wouldn't hesitate to return if going back to menorca,thank you Casas del lago.

title: hotel casas del lago
review: this hotel is really close to all things good in the resort .clean. the staff are first class.the rooms are very large and have plenty of room for putting your clothes away .the only downside was the food it was awful . not warm enough and not a great number of choices it was more for the Spanish French and german people.ate out 8 of the ten nights that we stayed.and other thing there is a local government tax keep your receipt they were asking me for it before I left .

title: Great hotel, brilliant location
review: Me and my partner stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and met some friends staying in the same hotel. Very clean hotel, beautifully kept. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Special mention to Lidia at the pool bar, 5*. Breakfast is very good quality and lots of choice although I would recommend going early as the food can get cold. The pool area is absolutely gorgeous with amazing views across the harbour and it's never too busy which is nice. Rooms were tidyed/cleaned everyday with towels changed ✅ Good choice of restaurants nearby, specially liked Aquarium and you do get 10% off for 4 of the restaurants if you are a guest of the hotel  (if you're bed&breakfast). Would recommend going into the main town of Ciutedella, definitely worth a visit especially if you're looking for a…

title: Brilliant Holiday
review: Just returned last Tuesday, Adults only, very relaxing, staff so attentive, Room great although bathroom good do with an upgrade. Poolside is good if you are on the Balinese beds but the so called beach look is very bad to walk on, would have been better if it was decker or grassed. This is one place I would recommend to people traveling alone.

title: Lovely time.......
review: A week at this hotel is a lovely way to spend a relaxing holiday. Excellent staff and management. But the cleaning staff could be a little more thorough!  Really lovely room (31) with plenty of space; bedroom, bathroom, living area, patio, kitchen are. the room is very well appointed an clean. The kitchen area has crockery, cutlery, microwave, kettle, fridge, etc.   The pool area is lovely, plenty of sunbeds (you have to pay for the bigger ones, but needn't sit there, there's plenty of free ones!). The pool is clean and the bar area well stocked and well run. There is a DJ for a few hours each day - a waste of money I think. It was May/June and there was loads of room, though I imagine it gets busier.  The hotel is peaceful and quiet and i would say certainly the best place to…

title: Just lovely....went too quickly.
review: I discovered this hotel last year whilst holiday with my family. I felt safe in the resort and was familiar with the area so happy to return as a lone traveller for my 40th birthday treat.  It is beautiful. Lovely setting, gardens staff and spa (limited to an hour) My room was fresh, bright and very clean. Well stocked kitchen. I had a few niggles when I first arrived (heightened due to the fact that I was tired, apprehensive and had been let down by my transfer company) but these were quickly addressed and resolved.  The food was just beautiful - every meal so tasty and although buffet it was very much nice restaurant standard.  I agree with the previous comments re the DJ- he just doesn't fit in with the ambience and there is already soothing music playing around the hotel. …

title: A difficult review to write
review: Firstly, this hotel is beautiful, with friendly professional staff and in a great location.  So much so, we returned again this year.  This time we paid quite a bit extra for a bungalow, we had number 77.  They are very trendy with their own patio with sun loungers looking directly on to the marina.  We arrived on a Saturday afternoon with no problems.  Sunday 7.30 am the sun is on the terrace and it was beautifully warm and peaceful.  I thought I had hit the jackpot.  Monday I again was on the terrace at 7.30, at 8.00 and my dream holiday was shattered as the building work began.  They are creating new rooms in the hotel on the front of the marina (most rooms are set back from the marina).  Drilling, hammering, angle grinders and deliveries of cement in trucks was a constant…

title: Short, but very enjoyable break
review: Dear Ann J,   Thank you for taking the time to add your review of Casas del Lago Hotel.  We are sorry for all the inconveniences caused and we really appreciate all comments to keep improving. Hopefully we can have you back in our hotel so you can see all the changes we have made and you can finally enjoy a lovely holiday in Menorca.  Best Regards, Elisabet Benejam Head Receptionist

title: Amazing
review: Me and my sister just came back from our little break in Minorca. We have booked 3 nights B&B at Casas del Lago Hotel. The service at the hotel and the restaurants which are part of the hotel was amazing. We would like to say big thank you to the nice ladies on Reception- Stanka, Elizabeth and Jess. The rooms are very spacious, the Spa is very relaxing and the pools outside are just perfect. We really enjoyed our little break and definitely will come back again.   P.S keep an eye on your plates for breakfast, because the seagulls are very hungry :) :) :)

title: Adult relaxed holiday -  no complaints here
review: Dear Gergana K,  Thank you very much for your lovely review regarding our Casas del Lago Hotel.  We really appreciate your good comments about the facilities and our reception staff, I am sure Jess and Stanka will be very thankful for that comment as I am. We are happy to read that you enjoyed your stay and we are looking forward to receiving you again in the very near future.  Warm regards, Elisabet Benejam Head Receptionist

title: One of the best
review: One of the best hotels we have stayed in ,we found staff very helpful and friendly ,rooms very clean and well equipped, only had breakfast at hotel but it was an amazing buffet with everything you wanted ,great location as well ,looking forward to next stay

title: Fantastic Chilled Out Holiday
review: Dear Drew_Morley,  Thank you very much for your lovely review regarding our Casas del Lago Hotel. We really appreciate your good comments.  We are happy to read that you enjoyed your stay in Menorca.  We are looking forward to receiving you again in the very near future.  Kind Regards, Elisabet Benejam Head Receptionist

title: Adults Only
review: I have just got back from a lovely chilled out week at Casas del Lago with my husband and we can’t praise this hotel enough.  When we were dropped off from our Thomson transfer bus, we were too early to check in (check in from 3pm) so they stored our luggage away and we headed to the pool bar for some lunch. As you leave the reception, you are greeted with a lovely view of the marina which is the outlook for the entire pool area.  During our stay, we found that there were plenty of sunbeds with many not being used, and you also have the option to hire the Balinese beds (18 euros) or Round beds (16 euros) if you want something a bit more luxurious for the day. The hire of these beds included 2 mojitos (or we opted for beer/soft drink) and some nachos. As others have commented,…

title: A perfect location, great facilities and excellent staff
review: Dear  B_King8,   Thank you very much for you amazing review of Casas del Lago Hotel. We really appreciate your good comments and it is good to know that all our effort to make our guests feel like home are effective and I am sure this comment will help others also.  It is a pleasure to read that you enjoyed our hotel and your holiday in Menorca.  We are looking forward to receiving you back in the near future.  Best Regards,  Alejandro Alguacil, Director CASAS DEL LAGO HOTEL 4*SUP

title: Wonderful
review: Just returned from a 7 night holiday after staying B&B at Casas Del LAgo Hotel .  The staff were excellent and very friendly, front desk staff very helpful. Beach Bar staff also helpful and polite, waiter service around the pool was good.  The spa facilities are excellent we made full use of the water thermal treatment room, which includes sauna, steam room, warm beds and of course water treatment. The bucket shower must be tried.  The gym contains a couple of bikes and treadmills. There is a good choice at breakfast, from english type breakfast, continental including fresh juices as well as cava. The hotel also has a deal with a number of restaurants were you get 10% of your bill. We did eat in one night and found plenty of choice and the food was tasty. Swimming pool is very…

title: Great break
review: I stayed in this hotel for 10 days during May 2017 and thought it was great.   Breakfast was good with lots to choose from. We didn't eat dinner in the hotel as there are plenty of nice restaurants around the harbour (Aquarium is great) and an excellent steak restaurant about 10 minutes drive from the hotel (Es Caliu).    The room was clean and modern, with basic cooking facilities. The bathroom looked a little dated, but it was in full working order. All of the communal areas in the hotel were really clean.   We drove to the hotel and there was adequate parking. Ask to use the hotels private car park as there are plenty of 'parking accidents' in the public car park.   We booked directly with the hotel and paid on arrival. This was really easy and helped us get a really great…

title: amazing!!!
review: Dear  Joe K,   Thank you very much for taking the time to add your review of Casas del Lago Hotel. We really appreciate your good comments about the location, facilitites and services.   We are looking forward to receiving you back in the near future.  Best Regards,  Alejandro Alguacil, Director CASAS DEL LAGO HOTEL 4*SUP

title: A First here - wont be the last !
review: Arrived to find we had been upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite with amazing views.  Rooms cleaned every day and kept spotless.  The views from the balcony overlooking the marina are just fabulous.  Breakfast in the hotel could not have been any better, everything on offer that you could wish for, and plenty of friendly staff to greet you.  Reception staff were very helpful, especially Stanka who always had such a welcome smile and nothing was any problem to her.  Pool area was amazing and you could have a lounger at any time of day.  Pool was a bit cold getting into, but once in it was fine to swim about.  Exercise bike and cross trainer in the pool which was great as it meant that you could stay outdoors to exercise.  The only gripe we had was the awful music played at the pool from…

title: Decidedly average!
review: Dear imacthisyear,  Thank you very much for taking the time to add a review regarding our Casas del Lago Hotel.  We really appreciate your good comments about the facilities, cleaning and staff and we also take in consideration all comments to try and get better.  We are looking forward to receiving you again in the very near future.  Warm regards, Alejandro Alguacil, Director HOTEL CASAS DEL LAGO 4*SUP

title: Fabulous Hotel
review: First  time we have stayed at Casas del Lago, very clean, lovely friendly staff.  Tried the spa, really felt the staff listened to your requirements and had a lovely pampering hour.  Our two gripes were the swimming pool was freezing, and the pool DJ who played 12pm - 4pm was rubbish, he managed to clear the poolside of people as it was so monotonous and boring.  Shame really because the rest was lovely.

title: Nice Hotel with a few issues
review: Good:  Hotel was very nice and good food  Bad: 1. Air conditioning was broken, spoke to reception several times however they were unable to fix it and couldn't offer an alternative room 2. Shower was leaking 3. Wasn't offered a "Lake View" room as booked

title: Amazing hotel,
review: Dear Nick W,   Thank you very much for taking the time to add your review of Casas del Lago Hotel. We take in consideration all comments to keep improving and we really hope we can have you back in our hotel so you can see all the changes for good.  Best Regards, Elisabet Benejam Head Receptionist

title: Nice big rooms overlooking the habour
review: Two bedroom suite extremely clean and spacious. The staff couldn't do enough for us. Especially Jorge the maitre d, and Virginia, who had just started at the hotel.All the staff were most helpful and  very accommodating. Full board was excellent value for money. The hotel is situated in a prime place with bars and shops a few minutes walk away.

title: Enjoyed every second.
review: Dear sharonhayward,   Thank you very much for taking the time to add your review of Casas del Lago Hotel. We really appreciate your good comments about the staff and services. It is a pleasure to read that you enjoyed your holidays in Menorca and at our Hotel.   We are looking forward to receiving you back in the near future.  Best Regards,  Alejandro Alguacil, Director CASAS DEL LAGO HOTEL 4*SUP

title: Amazing
review: The rooms at this hotel are very large,with 2 bedrooms both ensuite.We stayed half board in October the weather was 21 deg .the food could be a lot better.there is a bus stop right outside the hotel which is a must.the beach is across the road with plenty of walking around the coastline.There was plenty of sunbeds around the pool but it was October.

title: Spotless, friendly, beautiful
review: We both agreed this was the best hotel we had ever stayed in.   The hotel is perfectly located on the marina but only three minutes walk from the beach. There is a small super market across the road which is useful for lunch (as the rooms are like suites with some facilities!).   The pool area remained spotless with plenty of sun beds even at prime time. Towels can be rented free of charge with a deposit.   The real shining star for the hotel is their food and drink. Martin at the beach club bar served us lovely drinks and had a fantastic attitude and personality. The food in the hotel restaurant was authentically Spanish and did not cater for Brit tourists - refreshing for a hotel in Spain!   We would have nothing to criticise about the hotel or their staff. We look forward to…

title: Autum 2016 half board.
review: Hotel was great really no down side. However the restaurante on the small side although you could eat outside on terrace. For us the food was good and about right for a four star hotel. We would go back and recommend it as it overlooks the harbour.

title: room with a view
review: best resort I have stayed in on menorca always request an upper floor room pool and poolside bar are great breakfast good choice only negative is some of the reception staff could be more helpful great views over marina and nice and close to everything

title: Perfect location
review: My sister and I had a girls week here - second time - and we love the place. Room is a good size if a little dated, staff are helpful and adults only is great. Breakfast buffet is varied and fresh. We make our own lunch in the kitchenette and then hop on the bus (bus stop right outside the hotel) into Ciutadella to get to our favourite restaurants for dinner / exploring. The restaurants in resort are very standard so we only grab coffees or ice creams there. Loads of great walks and beaches to explore and if you hire a car, nothing is more than 45 mins away. We'll be back....😄

title: Luxury price tag, budget service
review: We chose this hotel as a change to our holiday to Turkey, due to the unrest we didn't wish to travel there, if only we had!!!  I based my choice on reviews here and also the information Thomas Cook gave me. We travelled in September, but I am only just posting this as I am awaiting a response from Thomas Cook..... On arrival rooms were not ready which is pretty poor considering the uk flights arrive into resort around lunchtime. No staff to assist with luggage and we were just left to find our room...  I have stayed in lesser 3* hotels and recieved a better welcome than this!  We had a two bedroom suite, now my idea of a suite compared to the hotel's is wildly different! A two bedroom apartment does NOT constitute a suite by any stretch of the imagination!   In the lounge there…

title: Wonderful holiday
review: My husband and I stayed here the first 2 weeks of September and had a fantastic time. We loved the hotel and found the staff were very good and friendly.  The atmosphere round the pool was just perfect for us and we used the round beds every day from about the 3rd day. They were worth the money to us as we booked it and this meant we could relax and do what we wanted without worrying about getting up to get a sunbed.  We did the bed and breakfast option which was perfect for us.  The breakfasts were excellent and if you missed it you could go for a late one at the fiesta  restaurant owned by the hotel which we did a few days.  Again the food was lovely and meant that we could have a lie in if we had too much mahon gin which we discovered and loved lol.  The marina was also a…

title: Comfort in Cala'n Bosch
review: We visited the hotel for a week from October 11th and enjoyed our stay very much.We received an upgrade to Room 103 which is one of the few rooms with a beach,rather than a marina outlook.The October sunshine was a little lacking at times,but what there was was on the balcony all day. Staff were courteous and efficient particularly Elizabeth and Jess on reception and the barman on duty at the beach club. Breakfast was good,with plenty of continental and cooked options.We had no experience of lukewarm food,and I liked the coffee,however I found the fruit juices much too sweet. There is a small gym with a non-functioning running machine,weights,two bikes,a cross trainer and a resistance machine. The pool area is gorgeous-very chilled and relaxing,and I liked the music that seems…

title: Nice spa and spacious rooms
review: We visited in early October for some end of season sun. The hotel is in an excellent location right on the marina. Being late in the season, it was very quiet and many of the bars and restaurants had already shut down. I'm sure it would have been very different in peak season. The staff in the hotel were all professional and friendly. The room is huge and although we had a garden view room, we actually had a good view of the marina. Good black out curtains and a comfortable bed as well as kitchen facilities including a kettle and fridge. The bathroom wasn't great as the shower was in a fixed position and ended up flooding the floor. We used the spa a few times. The thermal circuit was good and was free to use. I had a pedicure which was a bit pricey but the therapist did a good…

title: A lovely relaxing week.
review: We went to this hotel with our friends for a relaxing week and really enjoyed it.  The facilities were good, we especially liked the small gym, only ever used by the 2 of us, and the Spa.  Most mornings we had a very good breakfast and then went to the gym and spa, very good.  Our friends would relax and read, then we would meet up for a lunch at one of the marina restaurants. The rooms were good and the beds were very comfortable.  Basically you get your own suit, so each room has a lounge area and a terrace.  The shower room was excellant. The staff were very helpful and friendly, they couldn't do enough for you. The only downside was the evening buffet food.  We had gone on a dinner, bed ad breakfast package, I wouldn't do that again when there are so many good little…

title: beautiful location great hotel
review: Stayed here in 2015 what a hotel!we had a room overlooking the marina huge balcony and the room basically a bungalow with a gorgeous bedroom, bathroom and sitting area with a fully equiped kitchenette.  Finished using modern and minimalist furniture.  Gorgeous location on the marina beautiful pool/bar area and a great bus service into citidella which had beautiful cobbled streets providing an alternative to the beach and marina location if desired.  Will definitely.return

title: Very nearly, Great.
review: Overall very acceptable, Rooms spacious, clean and well appointed all very modern, white and minimal. Breakfast was very good with plenty of well prepared, appetising choices, from tortillas to bacon and eggs. Pool areas are spacious with plenty of bed options and a great view overlooking the Cala n bosch marina.  My only niggles were the tourist tax made at reception when u arrive, really! for an island that depends on tourism for the majority of its income, taxing individuals on arrival is a bit petty.  Also the charges for some of the more exotic looking sun loungers at the pool.... firstly I think once you've paid to stay in a hotel you should get to use the facilities provided? secondly, I would nt have chosen to pay for their sun loungers as most of them were covered in…

title: Fantastic location and views
review: Lovely hotel near the marina with stunning views. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms spacious with kitchenette and sofa bed. Lots of subeds and  free towels at the pool. Breakfast was great and lots of choice. If you are looking for a relaxing break this is the place to go. We went middle of October and a lot of the places to eat ,entertainment  and shops were closing for the season but we still enjoyed.

title: Wonderful
review: Casa De Lago  is a hotel  over looking  the marina. We did not notice  any thing more than a gentle sound of a boat  moving around the port or the distant  sound of music  from bars and restaurants  surrounding  the  marina.   The hotel  itself  has about 90 rooms almost  all  with a north face view of the harbour .  This is a blessing  in  the heat of the day. For those who need the sun there are a selection of sunbeds .  The pool is not heated but in October  pleasant .    The rooms have lots of power  points and a small  kitchenette with microwave   but no rings or cooker. A well laid out living  room  and enough  storage space  to empty your luggage .   The hotel  has a gym and spa with masseur  who also  attend  to the fitness  center . It is easy to spend a relaxing  hour…

title: 4*..... in name not service
review: Arrived late to a very pleasant looking hotel, check in easy and we received the free wine, 2 thermal circuit passes and free days balinese sun bed  and mojito vouchers  On the next morning  we went to the 'beach club bar' at the pool to reserve the bed... only to have to wait while the barman continued his on going conversation with one of the room-maids, finally managing to get him breakaway from his conversation he said to just talk which every bed we wanted, difficult as all the Balinese beds had bodies on or the standard 'beach bag reservation' techniques  ensuring we couldn't have what was offered, in stead we went for the round beds, which were still nice but not as offered. Towels were not offered, we needed to ask for these as he continued his conversation with his…

title: Relaxing
review: Couldn't fault it, spotlessly clean etc Would highly recommend and will definitely be going back. A really relaxing place with no kids! A great place to totally unwind. Hotel staff were very helpful and friendly, food was excellent!

title: Great Hotel & Staff, average Food
review: My wife & I stayed here for a week at the start of October, having stayed here a few years ago we were very pleased with the refurbishment. Our room (14) was close to the pool, and spa, and had lovely views over the marina. The room was immaculately clean and was thoroughly cleaned everyday by the very smiley cleaning ladies. We had everything we needed including TV, toaster, microwave, fridge and kettle and the decor was very minimalist but bright and we liked it. The pool area was great, plenty of loungers, and bali beds (surcharge), and the pool bar was a cool place to chill and enjoy a couple of drinks. All of the staff we met were fantastic, a special mention for Ana, she was so bubbly and always had time for a friendly word (we hope Andorra is not too cold for her). Our…

review: Dear wrensnestred,   Thank you very much for taking the time to add your review of Casas del Lago Hotel. We really appreciate your good comments about the cleaning, facilities, staff and services. It is a pleasure to read that you had a great time at our Hotel. title: Superb adult only contemporary hotel
review: Very nice comfortable hotel. Spacious suites - we ended up with a room with the mood lighting in the bedroom not sure I'd have paid extra for it but it was nice all the same. Food was very good and we liked the dine around option. All staff very friendly and helpful. Lovely pool area and we never found the music too loud. Would definitely recommend.

title: Almost fantastic
review: Dear Sarah P,  Thank you very much for your review of Casas del Lago Hotel and for your recommendation. It is a pleasure to read your good comments and know that you had a pleasant stay. We look forward to receiving you back in the very near future here in Menorca.  Kind regards, Alejandro Alguacil, Director HOTEL CASAS DEL LAGO 4*SUP

title: end of season visit
review: Just arrived home from holiday at this beautiful hotel and would very highly recommend for its location, cleanliness, friendliness of staff etc.  Stunning view from dining room and from our upgraded room.  Took a bit of getting used to the openness of everything (needed shower to steam up a bit before using as hubby not used to seeing my wobbly bits to that degree !!). Unlike some reviewers we loved the piped music and found it very tasteful.  Along with many others we felt the food was the only thing that let the hotel down .  Breakfast was good if you liked continental, with good choice of fruits, cheeses, pastries, juices and even champagne, BUT cooked breakfast was far from hot which was a big let down.  We had a game with other couples to see if anyone could find a warm…

title: Completely chilled out hotel
review: We booked this holiday last minute looking for a relaxing holiday before winter. We read lots of reviews which were mainly positive, and we were not disappointed with the hotel. On arrival early evening we were checked in very quickly by a very friendly receptionist (Jess) and on finding our room had a slight problem using the electronic key to release the patio door to the apartment, but that was probably down to the fact we had never used this system before. Once you got used to it wasn't a problem. The apartment has a lovely lounge area nice soft furnishings dining table and four chairs, kitchen area with fridge, toaster, kettle, sink, hot plate, microwave and enough crockery & cutlery to enjoy a snack in the apartment. The TV only had Spanish programmes in our apartment our…

title: Treated like long lost friends
review: Dear Geoff L,  Thank you very much for your lovely review regarding our Casas del Lago Hotel. It is always a pleasure to read such good comments and we cherish your recommendations as we aim at making our clients stay the best possible experience. We are delighted that you enjoyed our facilities such our spa and the hotel services. We are looking forward to receiving you back in the very near future.  Kind Regards,  Alejandro Alguacil, Director HOTEL CASAS DEL LAGO 4*SUP

title: Lovely Hotel
review: After travelling through and to cities in the U.K., Netherlands , Germany, Austria and Italy we chose to take a breath on The island of Minorca.  What a great decision we made and our choice of hotel was perfect.  Everything about it was great.  The food along with the wait staff..superb.   The bar and the bar staff.  Superb.   Very good cocktails.   Our room was well appointed and large enough to swing lots of cats around.  We could not have wanted for more.  We rented a car at the airport on arrival which gave us the independence to explore the island at will..... and we did.   The hotel staff let us know some less visited areas to explore away from the tourist hangouts.   The hotel was sheltered from the sea breeze making the pool area an attractive option to just hangout. …

title: Tranquility
review: Dear Spudsurfs,  Thank you very much for your lovely review regarding our Casas del Lago Hotel on Tripadvisor. We really appreciate your good comments about the food, staff and services. We are delighted to read that we met your expectations and you had a wonderful time with us. Finally, we would like to thank you for your recommendation.  We are looking forward to receiving you again in the very near future.  Kind regards, Alejandro Alguacil, Director CASAS DEL LAGO HOTEL 4*SUP

title: Pristine Modern Hotel
review: Lovely Hotel and Staff, only thing that let them down was the food, always cold and small portions, so I would advise anyone to go  self catering here,food at the beach bar  there was better, but slightly expensive

title: Beautiful and Clean Hotel
review: If you want a relaxing stress free holiday than look no further than coming to Casas del Lago Hotel. Can't fault it other than having to pay for the spa use after your one free admission and the posh sun beds but not necessary a real problem at all. (Just don't use them) Set around the marina with plenty of bars and restaurants  = perfect. Please note that there are only a few shops but you can get all the normal type souvenirs. 😎

title: The Coolest Place in Cala'n Bosch
review: Dear Zola384,   Thank you very much for taking the time to add your review of Casas del Lago Hotel. We really appreciate your good comments about the cleaning and facilities. It is a pleasure to read that you have had a relaxing holidays in Menorca and at our Hotel.   We are looking forward to receiving you back in the near future.  Best Regards,  Alejandro Alguacil, Director CASAS DEL LAGO HOTEL 4*SUP

title: Pleasant, relaxing stay
review: My wife and I have just returned from spending 11 nights at the Casas del Lago in Cala'n Bosch and it was overall a great holiday. The hotel is certainly the "coolest" place in Cala'n Bosch with probably the best location being just a few yards from both the beach and the marina. The views across the marina are stunning.  We found the hotel to be generally spotlessly clean and well maintained as was our room. We stayed in a deluxe beach suite which had everything you could want for your stay including a Kitchen area with hob and fridge which even though we stayed half board we found really useful. The staff were all pleasant and helpful, almost without exception. The bars are good and we were surprised to find that they are cheaper than some of the bars around the marina. There…

title: A little gem!!!
review: We booked our stay through BA holidays and it lived up to the positive reviews and photos online.   Our room didn't have a view to shout about but it was comfortable and clean and the full fridge was particularly useful. Powerful hot shower and very comfortable bed were also positives. The air con was also very powerful but extremely quiet, always a bonus when the temps were as high as they were when we visited.   We were pleasantly surprised by the breakfast. Plenty of food, lots of choice and all tasty. Some of the little cakes were delicious.   The lunch food is good too and the staff there very friendly.   Really nice, good sized pool. Plenty of sun loungers although be aware that you have to pay for the large, double loungers and they get reserved. You do get two cocktails…

title: Wow!  It is almost perfect!
review: This was our first time in menorca and as big fans of Ibiza we were not sure what to expect. When we arrived at the hotel we were offered an upgrade to a 3 bedroom Villa with a view of the harbour and its own pool.........!! We were shown to the Villa which was offsite from the hotel and above one of the hotels sister business restaurants, it was outstanding with loads of space, everything required for a restful 11 nights in menorca. The restaurants around the harbour mostly served excellent food with a few bars for pre dinner drinks, The Aquarium restaurant (which our Villa was above) was excellent for a lobster and seafood paella, On Egan, which did one of the best steaks my wife has ever had and next door to that Avanti who advertise themselves as a pizzeria but they are SO…

title: Chill in the sun
review: great place to chill and relax,spa an added little extra.Very nice atmosphere no loud music adult only  hotel.huge two room two bathroom apartment brilliant for four to share .breakfast excellent both continental and full fry up if wanted.plus all the other Spanish breakfast food. Dinner not as good but you do get to book a table in four restaurants around the harbour for free if on half board as with the hotel you pay for drinks.pool area was good lots of sun beds and also large 2 people beds with sun screens can be hired,pool towels also free but a 1 euro charge to change them for clean ones All in all a very relaxing stay but don't go here wanting bingo,pool games and alike its a bit better than all that.! the staff are fantastic nothing is to much for them to sort out . Also…

title: Our first holiday abroad in four years
review: We were welcomed by a lovely lady in reception after an early morning flight and were very happy to be told our room was ready at arrival at 2 o'clock instead of us having to wait until 3. We would not stay at this hotel again as the food in the evening is very repetitive, even for my partner, and I'm vegetarian and not a picky one at that, but not a lot of choice at all! Breakfast was nice and mostly hot, but filter coffee shockingly strong even if mixed with half hot milk. One thing I am NOT happy with is that I found a hard piece of plastic in one of the desserts (cake) and alerted the waiter who then looked at me as if to say "are you sure" and then proceeded to ask me "are you alright" and did not offer an apology or even a free bottle of water - we still had to pay!

title: relaxing atmosphere
review: Comfortable hotel, good food, great pool area, relaxing atmosphere.  All staff excellent, helpful, pleasant, attentive and very professional. We were full board and food was varied and plentiful with an arrangement to eat at some marina restaurants if you wanted. Would probably do b n b if we went again tho.

title: Excellent resort
review: My husband and I spent a week at this resort and it was fantastic. The room was a good size and very clean. We were overlooking the harbour and the pool. Holiday was very relaxing as it is adults only so quiet. The staff were lovely and very helpful. Food was great. I would definitely recommend this resort it you want a quiet relaxing break. If you want entertainment at night there was plenty going on around the harbour.

title: Anniversary Holiday
review: Dear TinaB,   Thank you very much for taking the time to add your review of Casas del Lago Hotel. We really appreciate your good comments about the cleaning, location, facilitites, staff and services.  It is a pleasure to read that you enjoyed your holidays in Menorca and at our Hotel. Finally, we would like to thank you for your recommendation.  We are looking forward to receiving you back in the near future.  Best Regards,  Alejandro Alguacil, Director CASAS DEL LAGO HOTEL 4*SUP

title: Fabulous
review: Check in good. Smily lovely reception staff.   Hotel offers a Balearic beach club vibe which is adults only. Think cafe del mar style music all day which is cool for us 40 somethings but some people found it too much.  It's a wellness hotel but not too much emphasis on the physical. Cava for breakfast and a bicycle in the pool. A rare aquarobics and Pilates class. Gym is small and great air con. Decent flat paths locally for running. Nice walks near by on a rough coastal path.  Food was a small buffet limited choice if used to big hotel buffets. Four dine out restaurants in the harbour offering inclusive set menus as an alternative in the half board package. Mexican, bistro, Brazilian and Italian. Made a welcome alternative.   Two bed suite with kitchenette. Sparse modern decor.…

title: Great hotel fantastic views
review: Dear QueenBHull,  Thank you very much for your lovely review regarding our Casas del Lago Hotel. We really appreciate your good comments about the facilities, staff and services. We will let our team know about your good mention. We are glad to read that you had a fabulous  holidays at Casas del Lago Hotel.  We are looking forward to receiving you again in the very near future.  Warm regards, Alejandro Alguacil, Director HOTEL CASAS DEL LAGO 4*SUP

title: It's a good place but it's not a perfect place.
review: Our first visit to menorca and we were not disappointed after reading a few reviews we stayed at casas del  it was a fantastic choice. The rooms have everything you need kettle , cooking , etc and are very moden should you decide to cook for dinner. The breakfast and evening meal is great all the food is to a high standard and a wide choice to accommodate all palettes. The pool is more than adequate with ample loungers and various beds . Only one downside is there is no entertainment in the evening but you have the use of the sister hotel next door should you wish or a slightly further walk in to the harbour were there are numerous shops , bars and restaurants. The hotel is situated overlooking the harbour with some great views of the aforementioned boats and bars and…

title: Not sure where to start
review: First trip to Menorca and I would recommend the Island, especially Ciutadella (bus stop outside the hotel or 15 euros in a cab) and Mahon (we hired a car for 59 euros for the day, big car park in the centre of Mahon). Cala'n Bosch is nice and the harbour really does come to life more at night. The beach is busy and son xoriguer beach is a 10 min walk - lovely calm shallow waters.  After reading other reviews about this hotel I am surprised to see that so few people seem to be of the same opinion as me. I agree that the Hotel is in a great location, being adult only is a definite bonus - the view from the balcony is superb. The room is lovely, big and clean - although it could do with a dressing table. The only real thing that lets it down is the lack of air conditioning - it…

title: Wonderful holiday
review: So I will start with the positives, paid extra for reasonable flight times, plus speedy boarding with easy jet, all good. Arrived at airport 10am. We, husband and adult daughter had booked the transfer coach at 12 euro each as could not get into room until 2 pm so was not bothered about a quick transfer and gave chance to look at the island, took about 1.15 mins, taxi takes about 1 hr, traffic depending.  On arrival bags were stored for us having removed swimwear etc, had no trouble getting sunbeds or umbrellas, had lunch at pool bar, good food slight problem as had to pay cash, no room number yet, not sure why as had asked repeatedly at reception what it would be, did not know, staff very polite said would ring when room ready which should be at 2pm.  At 3.30 went to reception…

title: Fantastic hotel
review: We went from the 2nd September to the 9th loved it from start to finish staff are fantastic nothing is to much trouble for them rooms well I loved them in honestly could not fault any thing we stayed in room 24 great view we got talking to the manager before we left he was so pleased we spoke highly of there hotel well worth a visit.

title: FIRST CLASS HOLIDAY ! 100%
review: Dear patjoe1111,   Thank you very much for taking the time to add your review of Casas del Lago Hotel. We really appreciate your good comments about the staff and services. title: Sunshine Galore
review: We've never visited Menorca before but reading the reports on this resort was a temptation we couldn't resist and we were not disappointed. Every single member of staff we came into contact with went the extra mile to assist in any way possible. The 'room' was really an 'apartment', so much room and lovely and spotlessly clean. The pool area was amazing and honestly, if you end up booking a round bed to laze on during the day they totally spoil you for returning to any kind of ordinary lounger believe me.  Sooooooooo comfortable. Free Mojito's with each bed every day too. Loved the music, loved the fact that the pool area overlooked the harbour which was lovely.  Food good and you have a choice in conjunction with the hotel to eat at other restaurants around the harbour to mix…
